metadata.title: CVE-2024-50218 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  ocfs2: pass u64 to ocfs2_truncate_inline maybe overflow  Syzbot reported a kernel BUG in ocfs2_truncate_inline.  There are two reasons for this: first, the parameter value passed is greater than ocfs2_max_inline_data_with_xattr, second, the start and end parameters of ocfs2_truncate_inline are "unsigned int".  So, we need to add a sanity check for byte_start and byte_len right before ocfs2_truncate_inline() in ocfs2_remove_inode_range(), if they are greater than ocfs2_max_inline_data_with_xattr return -EINVAL.
